metadata.title: USN-6073-3 -- Nova vulnerability
metadata.description: Jan Wasilewski and Gorka Eguileor discovered that Nova incorrectly handled deleted volume attachments. An authenticated user or attacker could possibly use this issue to gain access to sensitive information.  This update may require configuration changes to be completely effective, please see the upstream advisory for more information:  https://security.openstack.org/ossa/OSSA-2023-003.html  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6073-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  nova-api - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-common - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-xen - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-api-os-compute - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-novncproxy - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-serialproxy - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-api-os-volume - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-lxc - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-api-metadata - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-ajax-console-proxy - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-kvm - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-doc - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-conductor - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-volume - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-vmware - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-cells - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-spiceproxy - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-scheduler - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-libvirt - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-qemu - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 nova-compute-ironic - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 python3-nova - 3:25.1.0-0ubuntu2.1 No subscription required
